name: Range
description: Range represents a set of one or more contiguous cells such as a cell, a row, a column, block of cells, etc.

properties.name: address
properties.description: Represents the range reference in A1-style. Address value will contain the Sheet reference (e.g. Sheet1!A1:B4).

properties.name: addressLocal
properties.description: Represents range reference for the specified range in the language of the user.

properties.name: cellCount
properties.description: Number of cells in the range. This API will return -1 if the cell count exceeds 2^31-1 (2,147,483,647).

properties.name: columnCount
properties.description: Represents the total number of columns in the range.

properties.name: columnIndex
properties.description: Represents the column number of the first cell in the range. Zero-indexed.

properties.name: conditionalFormats
properties.description: Collection of ConditionalFormats that intersect the range.

properties.name: valueTypes
properties.description: Represents the type of data of each cell.

properties.name: format
properties.description: Returns a format object, encapsulating the range's font, fill, borders, alignment, and other properties.

properties.name: formulas
properties.description: Represents the formula in A1-style notation.

properties.name: formulasLocal
properties.description: Represents the formula in A1-style notation, in the user's language and number-formatting locale.  For example, the English "=SUM(A1, 1.5)" formula would become "=SUMME(A1; 1,5)" in German.

properties.name: formulasR1C1
properties.description: Represents the formula in R1C1-style notation.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Represents if all cells of the current range are hidden.

properties.name: rowHidden
properties.description: Represents if all rows of the current range are hidden.

properties.name: columnHidden
properties.description: Represents if all columns of the current range are hidden.

properties.name: numberFormat
properties.description: Represents Excel's number format code for the given cell.

properties.name: rowCount
properties.description: Returns the total number of rows in the range.

properties.name: rowIndex
properties.description: Returns the row number of the first cell in the range. Zero-indexed.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text values of the specified range. The Text value will not depend on the cell width. The # sign substitution that happens in Excel UI will not affect the text value returned by the API.

properties.name: values
properties.description: Represents the raw values of the specified range. The data returned could be of type string, number, or a boolean. Cell that contain an error will return the error string.

properties.name: worksheet
properties.description: The worksheet containing the current range.

properties.name: sort
properties.description: Represents the range sort of the current range.

methods.name: calculate
methods.description: Calculates a range of cells on a worksheet.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clear range values, format, fill, border, etc.

parameters.name: applyTo
parameters.description: Determines the type of clear action.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the cells associated with the range.

parameters.name: shift
parameters.description: Specifies which way to shift the cells.

methods.name: getEntireColumn
methods.description: Gets an object that represents the entire column of the range (for example, if the current range represents cells "B4:E11", it's `getEntireColumn` is a range that represents columns "B:E").

methods.name: getEntireRow
methods.description: Gets an object that represents the entire row of the range (for example, if the current range represents cells "B4:E11", it's `GetEntireRow` is a range that represents rows "4:11").

methods.name: getBoundingRect
methods.description: Gets the smallest range object that encompasses the given ranges. For example, the GetBoundingRect of "B2:C5" and "D10:E15" is "B2:E16".

parameters.name: anotherRange
parameters.description: The range object or address or range name.

methods.name: getCell
methods.description: Gets the range object containing the single cell based on row and column numbers. The cell can be outside the bounds of its parent range, so long as it's stays within the worksheet grid. The returned cell is located relative to the top left cell of the range.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: Row number of the cell to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: Column number of the cell to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

methods.name: getColumn
methods.description: Gets a column contained in the range.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: Column number of the range to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

methods.name: getColumnsAfter
methods.description: Gets a certain number of columns to the right of the current Range object.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of columns to include in the resulting range. In general, use a positive number to create a range outside the current range. You can also use a negative number to create a range within the current range. The default value is 1.

methods.name: getColumnsBefore
methods.description: Gets a certain number of columns to the left of the current Range object.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of columns to include in the resulting range. In general, use a positive number to create a range outside the current range. You can also use a negative number to create a range within the current range. The default value is 1.

methods.name: getResizedRange
methods.description: Gets a Range object similar to the current Range object, but with its bottom-right corner expanded (or contracted) by some number of rows and columns.

parameters.name: deltaRows
parameters.description: The number of rows by which to expand the bottom-right corner, relative to the current range. Use a positive number to expand the range, or a negative number to decrease it.

parameters.name: deltaColumns
parameters.description: The number of columnsby which to expand the bottom-right corner, relative to the current range. Use a positive number to expand the range, or a negative number to decrease it.

methods.name: getIntersection
methods.description: Gets the range object that represents the rectangular intersection of the given ranges.

parameters.name: anotherRange
parameters.description: The range object or range address that will be used to determine the intersection of ranges.

methods.name: getIntersectionOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the range object that represents the rectangular intersection of the given ranges. If no intersection is found, will return a null object.

parameters.name: anotherRange
parameters.description: The range object or range address that will be used to determine the intersection of ranges.

methods.name: getLastCell
methods.description: Gets the last cell within the range. For example, the last cell of "B2:D5" is "D5".

methods.name: getLastColumn
methods.description: Gets the last column within the range. For example, the last column of "B2:D5" is "D2:D5".

methods.name: getLastRow
methods.description: Gets the last row within the range. For example, the last row of "B2:D5" is "B5:D5".

methods.name: getOffsetRange
methods.description: Gets an object which represents a range that's offset from the specified range. The dimension of the returned range will match this range. If the resulting range is forced outside the bounds of the worksheet grid, an error will be thrown.

parameters.name: rowOffset
parameters.description: The number of rows (positive, negative, or 0) by which the range is to be offset. Positive values are offset downward, and negative values are offset upward.

parameters.name: columnOffset
parameters.description: The number of columns (positive, negative, or 0) by which the range is to be offset. Positive values are offset to the right, and negative values are offset to the left.

methods.name: getRow
methods.description: Gets a row contained in the range.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: Row number of the range to be retrieved. Zero-indexed.

methods.name: getRowsAbove
methods.description: Gets a certain number of rows above the current Range object.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of rows to include in the resulting range. In general, use a positive number to create a range outside the current range. You can also use a negative number to create a range within the current range. The default value is 1.

methods.name: getRowsBelow
methods.description: Gets a certain number of rows below the current Range object.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of rows to include in the resulting range. In general, use a positive number to create a range outside the current range. You can also use a negative number to create a range within the current range. The default value is 1.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Inserts a cell or a range of cells into the worksheet in place of this range, and shifts the other cells to make space. Returns a new Range object at the now blank space.

parameters.name: shift
parameters.description: Specifies which way to shift the cells.

methods.name: merge
methods.description: Merge the range cells into one region in the worksheet.

parameters.name: across
parameters.description: Set true to merge cells in each row of the specified range as separate merged cells. The default value is false.

methods.name: unmerge
methods.description: Unmerge the range cells into separate cells.

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects the specified range in the Excel UI.

methods.name: getUsedRange
methods.description: Returns the used range of the given range object. If there are no used cells within the range, this function will throw an ItemNotFound error.

parameters.name: valuesOnly
parameters.description: Considers only cells with values as used cells.

methods.name: getUsedRangeOrNullObject
methods.description: Returns the used range of the given range object. If there are no used cells within the range, this function will return a null object.

parameters.name: valuesOnly
parameters.description: Considers only cells with values as used cells.

methods.name: getVisibleView
methods.description: Represents the visible rows of the current range.
